intro: Stephanotrichum hispidum, commonly known as the hairy stephanotrichum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are hairy, giving it a distinctive texture, and its flowers are usually yellow or white. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
